course.subject: LIFS
course.name: Appreciation of Biological Sciences
course.description: This course introduces students to the fundamental concepts and principles of biological sciences, including chemical basis of life, cell structure and function, genetics and molecular biology, evolution, origin of life, diversity of life forms and their influence on human, structure and life processes in human, and ecology and environment. The inter-relationships between human, environment and society in daily life will be focused.
course.exclusions: LIFS 1901, LIFS 1902, Level 3 or above in HKDSE 1/2x Biology OR in HKDSE 1x Biology, a passing grade in HKCEE Biology OR HKAL Biology

reviews.author: enmity_long
reviews.comment_content:
***只限入學前無讀過生物的同學選修***

分開三部分，由三位老師任教。
Prof Wu: Basic Biology (Cell structure)
Dr. Melody Leung: Plants, Animals, Ecology
Prof Miller: Physiology, Human Biology, History of Biology (Nobel Prizes)

每課PPT頁數都很多（最少60頁，最多有試過約300頁，有時字海 有時多圖(記系統運作)）
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Wu: 讀PPT，沒有解釋太多，靠自己去背
Dr Melody Leung: 教得好好，好有心機，詳細解釋背後原理，令你明白一啲奇怪specific term的由來，令你容易記住。
Prof Miller: 好友善風趣，上堂會邀請同學做實驗，樂意解釋原理如何運作，唔會只叫你背。同教完會講清楚咩野你應該花時間記，咩野只係輕輕帶過。
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term 50%
Final Exam 50%
All MCs (每次50題)

Mid term 40/50
Final Exam around 85%
Grade: A-

有不少International / Exchange-in 同學讀，可能因為咁平均考試分數唔算太高，稍為努力成績就不錯。SBM, SHSS同學如果避開勁人，呢個course似乎幾岩你，不過苦功還是要落一下的。
reviews.comment_workload: 沒有功課，最大workload就是要記海量powerpoint，串字和不同System的運作。記憶力好的同學誠意推薦。

reviews.author: Seonghun
reviews.title: LIFS1010
reviews.comment_content:
Fundamentals of life
The perpetuation of life
Evolution
Diversity of life
Ecology
Human biology

Massive amount of content that is nearly impossible to memorize for the midterm and final exams.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Wu: speaks so slowly and has a sleepy tone.
Professor Melody: speaks so fast that has a very fast pace. When you are rewatching the lecture for the exam, it's very difficult to understand what she is talking in a 1.5x speed.
Professor Miller: my fav professor among the 3. Has a good tone.
reviews.comment_grading:
50% Midterm exam
50% Final exam
All MCQs.

Honestly, it's not so bad, but the content that I had to memorize is so large. I would say it is impossible to memorize correctly what had been taught in class.
reviews.comment_workload: There aren't any workloads to prepare for the class. However, if you don't study in between, you would have a hard time in the exam due to the large content.

reviews.author: m.howai
reviews.comment_content:
第一part 係基本chemistry 之後係講DNA.
第二part 講好多野，主要關於動物，Ecology. (focus 係佢講嘅concept)
第三part 係focus 人體上半部份，腦，心等等。(會講埋有咩重點要記)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Zhengguo 英文發音好好聽，但礙於內容上，其實無咩有趣嘅地方，主要都係要記。
Melody 就會好focus 係concept 上面，有一次佢拎咗個松果出來示範，浸水之後會打開，想知點解就上堂啦。
Miller 幾風趣，而且佢會講邊度要記，但去到後面都會比較複雜。
reviews.comment_grading:
mid-term : 50% (tricky)
exam : 50% (direct and easy) (conceptual)
overall : B
reviews.comment_workload:
對於唔慣記野嘅人來講，workload係算大。
因為如果你真係要記晒ppt notes入面所有細節基本上無可能。
圖上面嘅details 建議唔洗太仔細背。

reviews.author: Polly Lau
reviews.comment_content: 好多野背，教既範圍好廣，仲要有好多NDS屈你機
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor leung 教得好好，好有心教，好仔細咁教我地d biological term點記。
最好嘅係，佢會講啲moral values俾我哋聽，唔係為教而教
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz below mean
最後個essay無出分 唔知係點
最後c左
reviews.comment_workload:
本來剩係得mt同final，因為轉左online learning，取消咗final，轉essay
不過mt好多嘢背...

reviews.author: wings_grace
reviews.title: Good grade and interesting course
reviews.comment_content:
Very basic biology
consist of three parts
1) Atoms, molecules, and life’s chemistry
2) Evolution and diversity of life
3) Body function ( nerve system, muscle...)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Great teachers besides Prof. Wu. Dr Melody Leung is very funny. Prof. Miller's ppt and teaching are messy but i love his enthusiasm.

To be honest teaching is not very important coz the materials are easy to understand and everything can be found on Crashcourse videos.
reviews.comment_grading:
good grade.
All mc , no need remember the spellings.
reviews.comment_workload:
relatively little. no homework. just one midterm and one final

as long as you are good at reciting you are fine. There are quite a lot of things to remember, even the names of the scientists are tested. But can be recited within 3 days.

reviews.author: maec_trash
reviews.title: Interesting course with enthusiastic professors
reviews.comment_content:
The lectures are taught by 3 different prof. and all of them are experts in each field. Personally, the content is interesting and half of the students are from business school, so it won't be hard. All the stuff taught is fundamental and in-depth knowledge is not examined.

Prof. Wu's part
Sept 3, 5
Atoms, molecules, and life’s chemistry
Sept 10, 12
The cell: basic unit of life
The perpetuation of life
Wu
Sept 17, 19
Cell cycle and Meiosis
Sept 24, 26
Chromosomes and DNA

Dr. Leung's part
Evolution
Leung
Oct 3
Darwinian evolution theory
Evidence for evolution
Oct 8
Microevolution
Macroevolution
Origin and history of life
Diversity of Life
Oct 10
Viruses and prokaryotes
Oct 15

MIDTERM EXAMINATION
Diversity of Life
Leung
Oct 22
Protists
Oct 24
Fungi and plants
Oct 29
Invertebrates and chordates
Ecology
Leung
Oct 31
Population dynamics
Nov 5
Community
Nov 7
Ecosystems and the Biosphere
Environmental challenges
Human biology

Prof. Miller's part
Nov 12
The nervous system
Nov 14
Senses and the brain
Nov 19
Muscles and movement
Nov 21
Heart and circulation
Nov 26
Lungs and breathing
Nov 28
Kidney and excretion
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Wu's teaching is boring, but his ppt is precise and includes all the thing he discussed in the lecture. His lecture can skip. :D

Dr Melody Leung teaches very well! She explains the concept clearly, with interesting examples given for every topic. It's highly recommended to attend her lectures. You'll probably appreciate biological science!

Prof. Miller's ppt are chaotic, but he teaches very well and repeats the key points many many many many times. I especially like his part about psychology. It's FANTASTIC. It's better to attend his lectures since you definitely can't catch up if you read ppt only.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are only mid-term exam and final exam with 50 MCQs each respectively, which means that 1 MCQ accounts for 1% of the grade. It's EXPENSIVE. No attendance, assignment, quiz, essay......

Not very generous grading, but better than standard courses' grading.
Mid-term: Average: 33.5 (SD: +/-7.9) (my score is 34)
Final: Unknown, but it's easier than mid-term, I guess I got around 40.
Final grade: B (satisfied as I don't put much effort into this course, only attend most lectures and revise 2 days before the exams XD)
reviews.comment_workload:
No workload. All you have to do is attend both exams. You can watch lecture videos on canvas so you can skip the classes :D.
It's easy to get a B range, but you need to pay more effort if you aim at A range.

reviews.author: Fabia
reviews.comment_content: Interesting content
reviews.comment_teaching:
The entire course was taught by 3 professors.
It is very necessary to attend all the classes taught by the female professors, as her slides were quite simple.
reviews.comment_grading:
As long as you remember everything on the ppt, you shd be fine.
For the essay, just make sure you are writing about the environmental problems that are not mentioned during class.
reviews.comment_workload:
1 essay, 1 mid term, 1 final exam
You only need to submit an essay about one environmental problem.
The mid term was MC questions
The final exam includes both MCQ and essay,around 5 essay questions

reviews.author: Stephenine Chan
reviews.comment_content: Basic biology is taught in the lesson and the notes are clear enough. The first part of the course included quite a lot of chemistry which is a bit not related to biology. However, for the second part of the course, it is more likely about geography because of the classification of life and ecology. The third part is about human and we have studied about heart, nerve systems, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professors read through the PowerPoint. The lesson is quite boring but attendence is not taken.
reviews.comment_grading: I failed the midterm exam and I studied for the final and it turned out to be a C.
reviews.comment_workload: The course is good because you have no assignment and there is only one midterm and one final exam.

reviews.author: jerjer
reviews.title: 不俗
reviews.comment_content:
上堂內容唔錯 幾易明
但係好多野要背
我有讀過下bio所以ok
但係對於未讀過bio既人會好吃力
reviews.comment_teaching:
開頭幾好幾詳細
但係最後啲slide得番幾幅圖
reviews.comment_grading:
對我黎講幾好
因為我midterm高兩個sd
final高mean
B+
reviews.comment_workload:
冇乜 又冇prs
都冇quiz
又冇assignment
50% midterm
50% final
係common core輕鬆之選

reviews.author: jep
reviews.comment_content: Covers basic topics of biology like cells, ecosystem, classification of life like animals, plants, virus, etc. The last topic discussed were about the human body.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecture videos provided, lecture notes uploaded in advance.
The teaching differs from each lecturer but the lecture notes pretty much covers the content.
One lecturer (the last one) prefers student to come to class so he likes to show slides that were not included in the lecture notes in canvas.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm 50%
Final 50%

The test materials for final is not accumulative, only the topics discussed after the midterm.
reviews.comment_workload: No assignments at all.

reviews.author: iris1234
reviews.title: Good course if you are bothered to put in some effort
reviews.comment_content:
Prof Wu: Basics of Chemistry, Life's chemistry, Mitosis, Meiosis, DNA

Dr Ko: Ecology, Origin of species, Biodiversity, Animal Behaviour

Prof Miller: Human Bioligy, Muscles and movement, Heart, Lungs, Kidneys

content is easy if you have some science background in high school
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Wu: a little boring but he shares zoom recordings so you don't really have to attend class. He is very clear though and explains concepts well

Dr Ko: engaging and seems very passionate about the subject so it is nice to go to her classes.

Prof Miller: makes jokes and explains concepts and tries to be more engaging
reviews.comment_grading:
50% mid-term
- the mt was 50 MCQ which was really stressful but not really difficult
- mean:37/50   high:46/50   me:37/50
50% final (non cumulative)
- 60 MCQ
- forgot the exact mean and high, I got 50+ (but still less than 1SD above mean)

my final grade: B+
A little disappointed because I put in a lot of effort but I also skipped some of the classes/ didn't pay attention
reviews.comment_workload:
Not a lot of work, just need to attend every class as the exam content includes things discussed in class that isn't available in the ppt provided.
Prof Wu and Miller share zoom recordings but Dr Ko does not so it is really important to attend her lectures

reviews.author: Leannelau524
reviews.comment_content:
Prof Wu’s parts:
1. Fundamentals of Life
2. The Cell: Basic Unit of Life
3. Cell Cycle and Meiosis
4. Chromosomes and DNA
Prof Ko’s parts:
1. The Origin of Life
2. Evolution
3. Biodiversity
4. Threats to Biodiversity & Conservation
5. Behavioural Biology
6. Ecology of Individuals and Populations
7. Community Ecology
Prof Miller’s parts:
1. The Nervous System
2. Senses and the Brain
3. Muscles and Movement
4. Heart and Circulation
5. Lungs and Breathing
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Wu’s teaching was a bit boring to me but he did explained every details and concepts about each topics.
Prof. Ko’s teaching was okay that sometimes she will share some videos during the lectures to make it less boring. Her parts were easy to understand.
Prof. Miller was nice and his lectures were easy to follow.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm exam (50%)
Mean: 31.2/50
High: 46/50
Low: 13/50

Final (50%)
Mean: 43/60
High: 55/60
Low: 22/60

Midterm exam was actually more difficult than the final.
Got mean for midterm and slightly above mean for final:
Final grade = B-
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload. Only one midterm exam and one final. The exams are not cumulative and just MC questions. However, if you want to get a better grade, you have to be careful with all the details mentioned.

reviews.author: Hayarn Park
reviews.title: not too bad
reviews.comment_content:
Fundamentals of life
The perpetuation of life
Evolution
Diversity of life
Ecology
Human biology

What we learn in highschool + additional information.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Wu: boring but straightforward. He replies to our email in short period of time.
Professor Melody: speaks very fast but easy to understand.
Professor Miller: Has a great teaching skills and speaks in a great tone !
reviews.comment_grading:
50 percent  Midterm exam
50 percent Final exam
All MCQs.

One question is worth a lot for this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
A lot of memorizing and lot of workloads.
If you are good at memorizing, this course would be good for you.

reviews.author: 清水灣道
reviews.title: 少伏
reviews.comment_content: 一開始會教啲chem嘢 然後就開始大部分bio
reviews.comment_teaching: 講書都幾清楚同埋都幾有趣
reviews.comment_grading:
全部mc
但如果你背嘢唔叻，就超級超級超級唔建議讀，只會拉低你gpa
reviews.comment_workload: workload其實唔大，因為冇功課/quiz，但如果你想要靚grade，就應該真係要花好多時間，因為都有超級大量嘅嘢要背

reviews.author: pulchritudo
reviews.title: reciting course
reviews.comment_content:
Prof.WU: chemistry about biology etc.
Prof.LEUNG: creatures' catagories
Prof. Miller: some circulatory systems etc.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. WU:sleepy lectures, no need to attend
Prof.LEUNG: She would make everything clear, both the content of the lecture and what will be tested in the exam. Just recite every page of her powerpoint. Her powerpoint is clear.
Prof. Miller: He is very humorous and would make the lectures interesting. But his powerpoint is a little bit lengthy and he would test some names in final....
reviews.comment_grading: I got 43/50 in midterm and I don't know the final score. Final grade A.
reviews.comment_workload:
No homework, no attendance, no quiz, no project.
Only mt and final.But we need to recite lots of things which are almost every page of the powerpoint before exams.
If you do well in reciting and have learned something about bio before, you could try to take it. If not, run!!!!!

reviews.author: 科大公道伯
reviews.title: 理科唔好嘅同學 慎選！！！懶惰嘅同學更加要 慎選！！！ 容易一不小心爛grade
reviews.comment_content: 其他人會講 唔重要
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Wu 英文發音如何我真係評論唔到太多 因為佢把聲催眠過催眠曲 每次我都好努力想要堅持上堂聽佢講野 但實在太難啦 加上一點半呢個時間啱啱食完飯 飯氣攻心 好想訓教 所以基本上佢上堂我都好難專心去聽 真係非常催眠眼訓 然而佢中意問ppt裡面冇嘅野 所以你又唔可以唔聽.... 但我最後都係冇追recording 因為recording一樣睇好到好眼訓

Melody幾活潑幾正 聽得明又聽得入耳 上堂仲會互動玩下遊戲 同埋佢係真係可以令你理解宜家學緊啲咩！Prof.Wu就經常性用我聽唔明嘅term解釋我唔明嘅野....

Miller就中規中矩 上堂幾fun其實都 不過有時候會有d聽唔明 同埋ppt真係好長 當中好多無聊野 算係溫習時嘅調節劑

其實Miller同Melody都幾ok 我都幾中意
reviews.comment_grading:
本人爛grade得C- 其主要原因因為midterm冇考好
呢個CC係final midterm 各佔50% 所以令好多人覺得冇workload好正 話雖如此 平時係完全唔需要有任何野做 但考midterm同final嘅時候 個content都唔算少

個人認為midterm比final難頗多 特別係midterm時候考chem嘅部分 Prof.Wu出得比較難 好多野唔係溫ppt就知道 加上MC啲選項都好難估答案 Chem果part真係好難做 唔係dse果種出題方法 所以我midterm係唔及格

不過final相對真係容易好多 Miller同Melody都出得好正路 肯溫ppt就冇問題 係Miller果part多野背
最後我估我係final及格 頗多都識做

Grading係正路 努力同成績成正比
reviews.comment_workload:
midterm同final要溫習嘅時候就會有workload 平時真係0 不過建議早啲溫 上堂要盡力聽 唔好走堂

不過我個人覺得理科唔好 冇天分嘅同學可以考慮其他CC先
懶惰嘅同學 要慎選係因為呢科令你好容易可以懶惰 偷懶 導致最後爛grade

不過其實呢個CC唔差 願意努力嘅人我相信係唔會爛grade
不過唔知點解我midterm明明都好努力溫 依然唔及格...

reviews.author: Jimmy_ICF
reviews.title: Good grade course for industrious students
reviews.comment_content:
This course involve some basic chemistry and biology. Professor Wu's part is about chemistry, cells and DNA. Professor Melody's part is about evolution, classification and the ecosystem.
Professor Miller's part is about human physiology.
I have studied Edexcel IGCSE biology and some content of the course is actually harder. Though the overall difficulty is still quite low, considering it's just a introductory course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I love all three professors. All 3 profs have good accent and can explain things in a clear and concise way.

Prof Wu just repeat the content of the ppts and can be quite boring for some people. It's fine for me though. I can understand what he taught during lectures and that's the most important thing. He is quite friendly so if you have any questions feel free to ask him.

Prof melody explains things in a more interesting and funny ways and it is quite fun to attend her lecture. Her ppts are well organised and is easy to read. She's more like a high school teacher than a professor to me, which is very nice.

Prof Miller is very passionate in teaching. The part he teaches is the hardest among the 3 parts but he explains it really well. You may not understand it very well the first time but after reviewing the lecture recording, you should be able to understand it perfectly. However, his ppt is chaotic. No jokes. My brain hurts from reading the ppt. He's still a great prof though.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm:50%
Final exam:50%
No assignment and don't take attendance

My score:
Midterm:45/50
Final: The score is not announced but I'm quite confident in getting at least 45/50
Letter grade: A+

Here are some tips to get good grade:
1. Prof Wu's part and the first ppt of Prof Melody will be tested in the first midterm. The midterm is actually quite hard. Pay attention to EVERY DETAIL in Wu's ppt. For example, what is mol, how do amino acid form bonding with each others. EVERY SINGLE SENTENCE AND PICTURE IS IMPORTANT. Melody's part is easier and is more straightforward, just revise it normally and you'll be ok.
2. The final exam is a cakewalk. Prof miller and Melody's part is in the final exam. The questions are easy and not tricky at all, unlike the midterm. Remember to memorise the name of the important scientists mentioned in miller's ppt. At least 2 to 3 questions will be related to this. You don't wanna lose these valuable marks. For melody's parts, do not need to memorise the details of the pictures. Just study what she mentioned in lecture and it should be fine.
3. Use a at least 3 days to studied for both the midterm and final. Even though the content is not hard there are lots of stuff to memorise. You DO NOT want to finish studying it within a day. I drank 4 cans of red bull and pull an all-nighter studying. Trust me, you do not want to experience this feeling.
4. Make sure you review the lecture recording when studying. They're super helpful!

If you are willing to put in effort and study for a long enough time, you'll get an A+. 100%. Just memorise everything on the ppt and you can get good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Other than test and exam, there is zero workload.
It seems very good, isn't it? No, hell no!
There is just so much stuff to study and memorise and it's really painful to do so. If you hate memorising stuff, do not reg this course. You'll die. literally.
However, if you're good at memorising things and is hard-working, this course is designed for you. Go reg it, you'll not regret studying this course.

reviews.author: audreykencana
reviews.comment_content: Basic high school biology and chemistry. Talks about atoms to the ecosystem. You can definitely excel if you have learned science before.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Wu mainly reads the slides, but his exam is very detailed. Prof Melody is my favorite, she teaches enthusiastically and often uses a simple analogy to explain. Prof Miller also teaches nicely and often repeat the harder part of the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
50% midterm
50% finals
reviews.comment_workload: No homework at all, just that 2 exams. They don't take attendance but try your best to come to the lecture though they have lecture video. Don't study everything right before the final exams.

reviews.author: chorongie
reviews.title: Simply here to give credits to Dr melody
reviews.comment_content:
Introductory level biology content
Just like the title, so i am not gonna write much about the details of content since i am simply here to give credits to dr melody lol
reviews.comment_teaching:
Melody surely deserve a A in teaching!
She teaches the second part of the course. She tries to interact with students and think about different methods for us to memorise and understand the content easier. And she understand that this course is just a cc course so she clearly tell us that which of those content and concept we should understand and memorise and which of those doesnt need to. She tries to keep things simple and interesting so that we could follow her easily. She even specially organized a summary lesson at the last lesson of her session to prepare us for the part during final exam.
But i am not giving a A to the overall teaching since Prof. Wu is too boring in his lecturers by just reading his ppt out during classes.
While the third lecturer, Prof Miller, is nice and interesting but his teaching is not that on point.
reviews.comment_grading:
surely a good grade course
Midterm 43/50
Final idk but i guess i score around 40/50
Final grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
no attendance
no homework
no quiz
midterm and final non-accumulative
both midterm and final in 50MCQs
have lecture videos
so... it is pretty obvious that the workload is closely none

reviews.author: 好想cga過3嘅人士
reviews.title: 好正嘅CC！
reviews.comment_content:
-開頭Chem，跟住就好多Bio野
-海量內容涵蓋各種野包括eco system之類
-個人覺得中間由Professor Leung 教嘅enviornment+classification of life etc幾有趣，都學到野的，其他就麻麻

好似係general bio野，唔難理解。但dse讀過bio會被exclude，所以有讀chem或記憶力本身好嘅同學會幾著數！
reviews.comment_teaching:
-Professor Wu 嘅英文accent幾好聽，可惜講野勁悶，照讀ppt，但都會有心解答疑問～
-Melody (Professor Leung) 雖然英文唔太好＋Hong Kong accent，但教法就有趣好多，成日講笑話，ppt好clear方便你溫習<3
-Professor Miller好熱情，教得都幾engaging嘅，唯獨ppt混亂都冇人有，得幾個大point，勁難溫
reviews.comment_grading:
個人覺得好正！！
Midterm above mean within 1 sd
Final 冇出分但目測都好普通
B+!!!!!!!
本人學渣，已經超開心！！！！XD
-其實兩份paper都唔難，midterm比較陰險考埋上堂講過嘅野＋細微位（Professor Wu個part係咁），但小心d準備得好d應該會似我嘅frd咁攞A+
reviews.comment_workload:
-50% Midterm
-50% Final
零workload 零iprs 零participation 仲有 lecture video睇！
完全可以走晒堂（喂咁又唔好嘅lol）
-記得一定要睇翻lecture video溫習，只靠ppt唔得！
-記憶力好，可以背晒所有野的話，可以輕鬆擺好grade～
-誠意推介嘅cc，用黎拉gpa:)

reviews.author: 愛lam的男人
reviews.title: 唔好走咁多堂
reviews.comment_content:

MIDTERM EXAMINATION

Community

reviews.comment_teaching:
有七八成係照讀powerpoint
每講每張slide都可能加番幾句comments
要注意嘅係口講嘅野都有機會考
所以我唔建議走堂
同埋要jot notes
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm:
Mean = 34.5 // SD = 7.4 // Highest = 47
我係highest
除左我另外仲有一位highest
有少少意外
因為我預會有好多4字頭
最後加埋只有20個島有
Final:
冇stats 但我幾有信心啱左好多
最後拎到A+
reviews.comment_workload:
冇workload
你只需要溫notes同上堂
少少可以留意嘅野:
----唔好走堂同要jot notes
Dr Wu 同 Prof. Miller係要背實驗家名
Miller 仲會問實驗家係做左咩名嘅實驗
Melody唔洗背實驗家同實驗
年份我midterm同final都冇問所以應該唔洗
----如果只係得張圖而powerpoint入面冇額外用文字講解張圖嘅話佢多數係預你當係課外知識,唔洗刻意背
----Miller個part嘅問題唔記得可以'西'走d肯定係錯嘅答案先,我有好多題都係咁做,因為佢個d錯嘅答案多數都係好明顯咁錯
----midterm同final都係50題MC, 各佔50%
----Midterm都要認真溫,因為midterm同final一樣都係50%,死左就番唔到轉頭
----Miller聲稱依科除非唔去考,如果唔係都唔會F
----我DSE冇揀bio (真係完全冇讀,唔係讀讀下drop左) 但都有咁嘅成績,所以我惗依科應該冇其他人咁講咁差...?

reviews.author: Candace
reviews.title: High level of memorising but contents are relatively easy
reviews.comment_content: The content of this course covers the following 6 topics, including Fundamentals of life, The perpetuation of life, Evolution, Diversity of Life, Ecology, and Human biology. The contents are relatively easy to understand but the amount is quite large. Good memorising ability could manage the course easily. It is also recommended for students who have no biology background but interested in biology.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching of Prof. Wu is a bit boring. The teaching of Prof. Leung and Prof. Miller are far more interesting and engaging. In general all three professors went through all contents clearly with detail explanation. Especially for Prof. Leung, she likes to share with students a lot of personal experience in order to strengthen their understanding on the related topics, and to taught us more about environmental protection. The course also provides lecture video in case you missed any of the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is relatively good.
50% for Mid-term and 50% for final exam
Each consist of Multiple-choice questions only. Both the exams are not difficult but they requires high level of memorising.
My mid-term result is 0.7 above mean but I don't know the result of final exam, and the final grade I got is B+.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload of this course is very light. No homework, no project at all. No attendance taking. Only consist of a Mid-term exam and a final exam. Both exams are non-cumulative. Self-studying the lecture materials works as well. However, it is recommended to attend all lessons or watch all the  lectures video, as they could help you to better understand the content and memorise it.

reviews.author: 青灯白火
reviews.comment_content:
Prof Zhenguo Wu:
Basic biology concepts. Carbohydrates, DNA, cell structure, cell cycle.
Prof Melody:
Classification system, virus and bacteria, Protista, fungi, plants, animals, ecosystem.
Prof.Miller:
Nerves, senses and brain, muscle, heart, lungs and breathing.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Zhenguo's class is quite sleepy. You can't clearly hear what he says.
Melody's teaching is good. She speaks in a fast pace but you can catch up with her. She knew that this was  a CC so that she explained the key words in detail.
Miller is a nice professor. But his powerpoint is too long so it's difficult for you to review.
reviews.comment_grading:
50% midterm
50% final

midterm: I got 43/50
final grade isn't released, but I think it's not bad.
overall: A
reviews.comment_workload: You need to prepare for a long time before exam. If you have a good memory and interested in biology, it's a good CC and not difficult to get A range. You should be ready to spend much time in reviewing.

reviews.author: DuckAndChips
reviews.title: Interesting course, light workload with reasonable exam
reviews.comment_content:
Full course outline can be found in the attachment.

The content is broad and introductory. Basic understanding of concepts is already adequate for the final examination.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Three professors teach in this course.

Prof. Wu is in charge for the first half of the course. His teaching is really boring and he only reads the power-points. In addition, he was behind his teaching schedule and had to cut down the syllabus, where those being cut down (e.g. meiosis) are foundational knowledge for chapters afterwards. I had to research the topic myself to fully grasp the concepts. One good thing about Prof. Wu is that his power-points are very clear and I can do revision easily.

Prof. Melody and Prof. Miller are in charge for the second half.

Prof. Melody is in charge for ecology and biodiversity. Her teaching is very easily understood and are interesting. She often teaches us tricks on how to remember certain terms and shares with us a lot of her appreciation to biology. She also incorporates some games into the lectures. She also often tells us which parts are being tested and which parts aren't. Her teaching is overall very good and she made me become more interested in biological sciences.

Prof. Miller's lectures are so-so. His lectures are less organised but kind of intriguing - feels more like a talk than a lecture. One point to note is that you have to review his lecture videos for some main points as some pages in the power-point will only be shown in his lectures. Also remember to memorise the names of some of the major scientists he mentioned.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is fine. This course seems less competitive compared to other courses in UST. Prof. Melody has said that she will not be too harsh on grades as she stresses on the appreciation of biological sciences but not the knowledge of them.

Exams are non-cumulative, meaning materials tested in midterm will not be tested in finals.

Midterm: 38/45 Mean: 31.9
Final: 43/50 Mean: 36.9
Final grade: A-

No attendance.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload solely depends on the examinations.

Spending 1-2 days before exam watching lecture videos and tidying up the knowledge is already enough for your examinations.

reviews.author: Jasa
reviews.title: Good CC
reviews.comment_content:
Midterm (Prof Wu): chemistry, some microbiology like the cell, protein
Final (Prof Melody, Miller): ecosystem, classification, and the human body

I didn't learn Bio in HKDSE, but to be honest, I learnt a lot in this introductory course and it is satisfying.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Wu's teaching is pretty average. You may need to take some notes in the class.

Melody's teaching is the best, very detailed explanation and you won't feel bored. Very precise Lecture note (~15-30 page 1 lecture)

Miller pretended to be funny but he isn't. His PowerPoint is SHIT. (100-150 pages 1 lecture)
reviews.comment_grading:
Pretty fair in allocation.
A: 28% of the class
B: 38% of the class

All MC form exam:
Midterm: 50%
Final: 50%

For my grading, I got A with the following marks.
Midterm: 40/45, mean 32, high 43
Final: 46/50, mean 37, high 49

A reminder is that Wu ask very detailed in the midterm, and you may need to care more about people name in Miller's part.
reviews.comment_workload:
Zero workloads. No assignment and attendance. Only 2 exams.

For me, Midterm and final both take ~1 week to watch all lecture video and revise. So you can ignore normal lessons, just start study 1 week earlier.

Spelling is not tested in the exam (MCQ), so you just need to memorise this is this, that links to that.

If you are good at memorising thing, this cc is a value.

reviews.author: notverysmart
reviews.title: Very basic biology with lenient grading
reviews.comment_content:
Very basic content

Lecture videos are provided!

Cells, muscles, heart, organ and organ system, ecology, evolution and such.

All of this materials are covered in both the SAT subject test and A levels. I highly recommend taking this course if you have studied biology in high school since the materials offered in this course are relatively similar to your high school biology.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I cannot stress enough the importance of attending class and/or watching the lecture videos as key points may not be included in the lecture notes, but will appear in the exam. The best thing about this course is that all three professor understand that this is a common core, and will try their best to include hints on which parts are important and which parts are not for the examination.

Professor WU's style of teaching is slightly monotonic and arguably boring. However, I enjoy parts covered by him as I find them quite interesting. It is important to pay attention to every single piece of detail for his part, both in the lecture notes, and in his lectures if you are aiming for an A+(yes, even the most ridiculous parts).

I especially enjoy Mrs. LEUNG's grace in teaching. She is compassionate in explaining key concepts as she understands that her part requires deep understanding and not just memorization. The questions she prepared for the exams are relatively straightforward and simple.

Professor Miller is a very interesting person with an equally interesting british accent. He includes thoughtworthy researchers and their research both in the field of science and psychology in his parts. Professor Miller will often dictate what will appear in the exams and what will not.
reviews.comment_grading:
50% Mid Term
50% Final (non-cumulative)

Around 50 MCQs for the mid term and the final.

Professor WU covers the most basic part of biology. However, it is important not to underestimate his part as it is the most difficult in the mid term. You will need to pay attention to even the SLIGHTEST DETAILS from both his lectures and his slides as they will definitely appear in the exam.

Mid term is harder than the final exam.
reviews.comment_workload: No workload, no attendance. Just study your heart out before the exam and you'll definitely get an A range.

reviews.author: Windy
reviews.title: Great course
reviews.comment_content: Basic biology that you should be familiar with if you take it in high school
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professors will take turns in teaching starting from professor Wu, Melody, and Miller. Professor Wu is a bit boring, but things he mentioned in class will be included in the exam. Professor Melody is the most fun, but she speaks very fast. Finally, Professor Miller is also ok in teaching, but he provides 90+ slides every powerpoint which some of them are repetitive and not quite related to the content material.
A tip: you should go to the lectures if you have time, but if you are super busy, you can always look at the video lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very good grading. 2 exams:
- midterm: 50% MC questions
- final: 50% MC questions
just review all the powerpoints and you should be fine.
reviews.comment_workload: No workload at all. Just start about a week / 5 days before the exam to review. Lecture videos really help!

reviews.author: ip
reviews.comment_content:
f3 chem (periodic table, ionic bond, whatsoever bond)
f3 bio (carbohydrates proteins lipids etc)
Cell DNA reproduction
Vertebrates
Invertebrates
Animals
Protista
Plants
Bacteria
Nerves system
Muscle
Heart
reviews.comment_teaching:
Quite clear with many explanation for wuzhengguo tho many technical terms are not in the ppt u might hv to Google or YouTube

Melodys teaching is very clear. She's a hker so she often uses chinglish or even Cantonese to illustrate concepts.

Miller is trying to make everything simple. Many Nobel peace prize winners which will be tested in final exam.
He will repeat important things which will appear in the exams for at least 5 times.
Ppt is messy with pics only. Not much words hv to refer to lecture vids
reviews.comment_grading:
Very generous grading.
Highly recommended for sci idiots like me (no sci background didnr take phychembio)
reviews.comment_workload:
No workload.
I watched lecture Vids regularly before midterm turns out just mean.
Watched 12 Vids all in a row during finals for 4 days, no time to memorize or revise thoroughly, still got an okay grade

Skipped all lessons. Lecture Vids are provided. A range achievable
For the final, just rmb to recite the names they are more important than the concepts as around 5Q's were about the winners.

reviews.author: Striver
reviews.title: Quite good grade
reviews.comment_content: Quite a lot of topics covering a bit of DSE scope. I did not study Bio before so I just borrowed books from ny high school friends. It did help a little.
reviews.comment_teaching: The whole course is divided into 3 parts taught by 3 professors. The first one is Prof Wu who just deserves a bad grade of E. So boring in lesson. He just keeps talking according to notes without initiating any group discussion or asking questions. The second one is a female professor but i already forgot her name sor;) She is quite friendly and tries to create a more interesting learning vibe. She can have a B. As for the last one is Prof Miler. Actually I have skipped all his lessons and I just watched one lecture video. He is quite nice but has too many useless lecture notes.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite good grading. But you need to bear in mind that there must be some students with biology background. The mean is not low too.

But to be frank, the questions are a bit ridiculous. For example, they ask you what is the famous experiment of “a named person”. So funny
reviews.comment_workload:
Almost zero workload. Only one mid term and one final. All the MCQs.

No assignments no group projects no attendance no quiz

reviews.author: choitszying
reviews.comment_content:
Atoms, molecules, and life’s chemistry
The cell: basic unit of life
The perpetuation of life
Cell cycle and Meiosis
Chromosomes and DNA
Evolution
Darwinian evolution theory
Evidence for evolution
Microevolution
Macroevolution
Origin and history of life
Diversity of Life
Viruses and prokaryotes
Protists
Fungi and plants
Invertebrates and chordates
Ecology
Population dynamics
Community
Ecosystems and the Biosphere
Environmental challenges

Human biology
The nervous system
Senses and the brain
Muscles and movement
Heart and circulation
Lungs and breathing
Kidney and excretion
reviews.comment_teaching: A bit boring but all the professors are passionate and nice.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair.
The two examinations are not hard.
Easy to get A range if you are good at memorizing things.
reviews.comment_workload: Extremely low workload. No homework at all. You only need to attend two examinations.

reviews.author: PPBBB
reviews.title: CC course for students without biology background
reviews.comment_content: A course with a very wide range of knowledge, from individual cells to ecology and then back to human bodies. The contents are very interesting if and only if you love to study biology. (i.e. you need to be passionate about studying biology in order to follow the contents and materials taught in class.)
reviews.comment_teaching:
I think each of them has different style of teaching. Professor Wu most of the time read from the PPTs, but he explained concepts very well, both in class and after class.

Dr. Leung was a kind of exam-oriented person. She usually said, "It doesn't matter as it won't appear in exams". She did revision with us before the exams but that's the trick. Actually, I found that most of the stuff she said is important did not appear on exams. She sometimes asked some minor questions from her notes.

Professor Miller is a very cheerful man and he explained every concept very well. He repeated one concept for more than ten times in one lecture and tried to impress us. The questions asked by him in the exam are quite straightforward and those questions are concepts that he emphasized in class.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair, 50% midterm and 50% final, If you fail one of them, then I think you would probably get C range. Exams are not cumulative. Midterm covered professor WU's part and 1 PPT of Dr. Leung's part. ( midterm is quite tricky and not that direct) Final covered other PPTs of Dr. Leung's part and Professor Miller's part. (Final is quite direct and easy indeed)
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload if you did regular revision after class or every week. I strongly advised you to attend the lectures and don't wait until the lecture videos were posted online.

reviews.author: Walhalancs
reviews.comment_content:
For No Biology Background students Only
This course is divided into three parts:
Prof Wu : Life Chemistry, Cell Cycle, DNA
Prof. Melody:  Evolution, Ecology,
Prof Miller:  Circulation system, Nervous System, Muscles, (Nobel Prize winner..)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Wu : teach according to the powerpoint slides, sometimes there may be some important stuff in his saying (for the exam)

Prof Melody: Interesting lessons, tips class before exam, well-organized ppt

Prof Miller: He is extremely passionate in his teaching, just I don't get the parts while he is so enthusiastic to say thing new to us...(Poor powerpoint for black background, and 200 pages something ppt)
reviews.comment_grading:
Very lenient grading indeed,  midterm 38/47, final exam predict 40/50
and finally get A-

The courses only have newbies to biology, usually business student and engineering student, science student may be taken lifs1901 instead of this. Heavy memory is needed, or u have very-well understanding towards the topics
reviews.comment_workload: Just exams with MCs, no workload indeed

reviews.author: win
reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment_content:
Course goal: This course aims to introduce to students diversity of life forms; origin of life;
chemical basis of life; cell structure and function; genetics and molecular biology; structure
and life processes in animal and plants; evolution; ecology and environment.
Intended learning outcomes:
1. Explain fundamental principles and inter-relationship among biochemicals, cells, and
life.
2. Describe the process of evolution and its implication in biodiversity.
3. Describe the structure and life processes in human.
4. Explain the inter-relationship between organisms and the environment.
5. Apply the biological knowledge in explaining current issues relating to human life.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is fine, most of the students skipped class because the lecture video is uploaded in canvas.
Teacheer don't care, so your mark wont be affected even though you didn't come to any of the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
It only depends on your mid term and final exam .
They are MCQs by the way.
Both carry 50 % of your marks

It is recommended for those who are strong in memorizing .

Most of the students have biology background even though they took business stream in the end
reviews.comment_workload: No workload at all .

reviews.author: Cqt
reviews.title: Grading is not too bad, but the workload , god .w.
reviews.comment_content:
Pre mid term:

Prof. Wu's part:
-Atoms, molecules, and life’s chemistry
(aka basic chem stuff + some organic chem stuff)

-different types of cells, cell structure, cell cycle, DNA struff

Dr. Melody's part:
-Origin and history of life
-Evolution
-Darwinian evolution theory, Evidence for evolution
-Diversity of Life
-Microevolution ,Macroevolution

Post mid term:

Dr. Melody's part:
-Microevolution ,Macroevolution (talks a little bit about this again)
-Bacteria, Viruses and prokaryotes
-Protists
-Fungi and plants
-vertebrates animals, invertebrates animals and chordates
-ecology
-population dynamics
-Ecosystems and the Biosphere
-Environmental challenges

Prof miller's part:
-The nervous system
-Senses and the brain
-Muscles and movement
-Heart and circulation
-Lungs and breathing
{Well he originally planned to talk about Kidney and excretion as well but we ran out of time}
reviews.comment_teaching:
Things to take note of:

-Prof Wu's lectures are pretty boring ngl, but his powerpoints are very detailed and I suggest you to watch his lecture vids/ attend the lectures because he would ask tiny details as well
{from what I remember during mid term like one of the questions may not even have been taught???? How tf r we suppose to know the answer 0-0}

-Dr melody's lectures are pretty fun. She tries to make the lectures more interactive (e.g: uses hand gestures, let us play a game to guess what animal the other team is describing, putting a pinecone in water and later show us the state of it again {experiment :D} etc ) Imo its much less stressful than Prof Wu's lectures and is easy to get what she's saying. Her powerpoints are pretty organized and it makes revision easier so <3 thanks Dr melody

-Prof Miller teaches passionately. He likes to repeat key concepts many times (not just by speaking out loud, but also in ppt which is one of the reasons why his ppts has many many pages, and speaking of ppt, he does excludes certain pages of the ppt he uploads to canvas, so remember to attend his lectures/ watch the lecture videos). The background color of the powerpoint is black tho so editing it for revision might be troublesome .w.


And oh attendance is not mandatory so yes you can just skip all lectures if you want
reviews.comment_grading:
Around 100 Mcs in total. They would try to give around 50 Mcs in mid term and 50 mcs in final.

Things that are not talked about post midterm (i.e: pre midterm content) will not be asked in the finals

Grading:
Mid-term 50%
Final Exam 50%

My grade for your reference:
Mid term: 37/45
Final:43/50

Final is generally easier than mid term
Grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload:
No attendance taken and no assignment, but there's just...
So. Many. Things. To. Memorize.

As a person who isn't really THAT good at memorizing, I thought I could still get A range if i try hard enough

And so I spend at least triple the lecture time after each lecture to make notes and catch any tiny details that is talked about in lectures.
(It can take me the entire day to memorize+ make sure I understand at least most of the things taught)

And of course I would go back to the notes I've made before the mid term/ final and make improved version of my notes to make it easier for myself to revise.

I've spent a lot of my spare time on this, and yet still ended up with a B+

This grade at first glance is not too bad, but if you take account of how much time is spent to get this grade, whether it is worth the trouble is questionable. You could have honestly spent the time spent on this course on other subjects instead and score better there.

tldr:
So many things to memorize, so if you are not good at memorizing stuff then expect a hefty amount of workload to secure your grade.

reviews.author: namreh
reviews.title: Average Course
reviews.comment_content:
So if you have studied biology in high school before, just take this as a CC. You could get a good grade easily.
The course is all about DNA RNA, evolution, muscles contraction and basic heart functions.
But if you have not studied before and have no interest in life science. Just skip this course.
Personally I am not into lifs and I do not enjoy doing this course. I find the lecture boring and fall asleep frequently.
One more important thing is that only reg this course if you have chemistry background. To understand the materials covered in mid-term, you would have an edge if you know a bit chemistry before. If you do not, you may feel very frustrated.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The course is taught by three prof.
The teaching of Prof WU and Prof Miller is not very good. It is sometimes quite confusing. But they are willing to answer questions from students.
The teaching of Prof Leung is quite good. I do not fall asleep during her lectures. She is able to explain clearly also.
Lecture videos are available on Canvas.
reviews.comment_grading:
1 mid term and 1 final only, both of which have 50 MC.
Mid term and final are not cumulative.
Quite good grade.
Midterm 43/50. Final mark is not released. But I expect I get around 40.
Finally it turns out to be an A-
reviews.comment_workload:
Nothing to do.
Only 1 midterm and 1 final.
Both contains 50 MCQ.
I studied several days before mid term and get 43/50.
After mid-term, I skipped most lectures and watched all the lecture videos only two days before final. I could handle the exam easily also.
So if you have a chemistry background and have some interest in lifs, reg this course.
